column4: can you test your ability access those sites through a free proxy?  eg. anonymouse
i forgot to mention in the post that both routers have the same ISP
go to anonymouse and enter the address of the site you have trouble accessing http://anonymouse.org/
the thing is the page itself loads, but for example the youtube clip won't even start or load, and on the yahoo mail page, when i click on a mail message, it just loads forever and doesn't show it
you use firefox?
this issue appears in every browser i use: Firefox, Seamonkey, Chromium, and only from my home router
the thing is i can't access my workplace router to find it's settings so i can copy them to my own router
so, any ideas?
no clue at all...maybe try different dns servers?  edit your connections' IPv4 Settings, set it to Automatic (DHCP) Adresses Only, and add this to DNS servers: 8.8.8.8, 8.8.4.4 (those are google's)
the router is on dhcp
i will try the google dns thing
tried the google dns think, no change
bah i'm out of suggestions, sorry
you hard-resetted the router, or soft?
i hard reseted it about 3 times, and soft reseted it 2 times
got any ip filtering software running (suck as moblock)
you tested from an ubuntu live cd environment? (sorry for all the obvious questions)
that i didn't do, don't have one handy, but i will
thing is they both worked fine, until some ubuntu updates a few weeks back
both wireless
anyhow, maybe update your post with more details like all these things you tested, it might help get a faster reply :-)..i gotta go, so good luck i hope you figure it out!
thanks
